articles.title: Malte Lüken
articles.contents:
Home
      
      
      CV
      Publications
      
      
      
      ☰
      
      
      
        
          
            Malte Lüken
          
          
            
              Graduate student in the Research Master’s Psychology at the University of Amsterdam with a focus on methodology and statistics. My research interests are computational modeling, (Bayesian) statistics, and machine learning applied to cognitive and clinical psychology. Open science advocate and enthusiastic piano player. Soon-to-be PhD candidate at KU Leuven.

articles.title: Publications
articles.description: Here you can find a list of my publications and other contributions.
articles.contents:
Lüken, M., Edenbrandt, A. K., Lagerkvist, C., & Orquin, J. L. (2019, June 12-14). The role of alternative-non-attendance in consumer decision making: Evidence from an eye-tracking study [Paper presentation]. 38th Meeting of the European Group of Process Tracing Studies, Dresden, Germany.
Lüken, M., Kucharský, Š., & Visser, I. (2020). Characterising eye movement events with an unsupervised hidden Markov model. PsyArXiv. https://doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/wvp2f
Schoemann, M., Lüken, M., Grage, T., Kieslich, P. J., & Scherbaum, S. (2019). Validating mouse-tracking: How design factors influence action dynamics in intertemporal decision making. Behavior Research Methods, 51(5), 2356–2377. https://doi.org/10.3758/s13428-018-1179-4
Thesis Projects
Lüken, M. (2021). Don’t make it too easy - Optimal error rates for parameter identifiability in evidence accumulation models [Unpublished master’s thesis]. Unversiteit van Amsterdam.
Lüken, M. (2018). Gammaregression: Reaktionszeitanalyse im Kontext von ADHS [Unpublished bachelor’s thesis]. Technische Universität Dresden.
